docs.abstract: Microsoft employees presented Satya Nadella, the chief executive, with a petition signed by over 300,000 people that called on the company to cancel its contract with ICE.
docs.snippet: Microsoft employees presented Satya Nadella, the chief executive, with a petition signed by over 300,000 people that called on the company to cancel its contract with ICE.
docs.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO — Microsoft employees questioned the company’s chief executive, Satya Nadella, on Thursday, presenting him with a petition signed by more than 300,000 people that called on the software maker to cancel its contract with the Immigration and Customs Enforcement agency, according to two people who attended the event.

headline.main: Microsoft Employees Question C.E.O. Over Company’s Contract With ICE
headline.print_headline: Employees Confront Microsoft’s Chief Over Contract With ICE

docs.abstract: The cloud computing market is booming, but companies are leery of relying on one tech giant. That is helping Microsoft.
docs.snippet: The cloud computing market is booming, but companies are leery of relying on one tech giant. That is helping Microsoft.
docs.lead_paragraph: Just a few years ago, Thomas M. Siebel often faced skepticism when encouraging big companies to adopt internet-style cloud computing. Many companies, he said, had qualms about relying on the faraway data centers.

headline.main: Microsoft Emerges as Clear No. 2 in Cloud Computing
headline.print_headline: Microsoft Emerges as Clear No. 2 in Booming Cloud Computing Market

docs.abstract: Amid a growing call for governments to rein in the use of the technology, Microsoft became the first tech giant to join the chorus.
docs.snippet: Amid a growing call for governments to rein in the use of the technology, Microsoft became the first tech giant to join the chorus.
docs.lead_paragraph: Microsoft on Friday became the first tech giant to join a growing call for regulations to limit the use of facial recognition technology.

headline.main: Microsoft Urges Congress to Regulate Use of Facial Recognition
headline.print_headline: Microsoft Urges Rules for Facial Recognition
